newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - June 2.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - June 2.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
- China government securities depository trust and clearing company prepares to launch nationwide custody and clearing system for treasury bills.
- China sets 33 percent tax on local currency business of foreign banks though China Daily notes that foreign exchange business of same banks will be taxed at 15 percent.
- Guangdong Overseas Chinese Trust and Investment Company takes over Guangdong Nanfang Financial Services General Company.

- Fuji Heavy Industries signs letter of intent to invest $36.87 million to take 51 percent stake in subcompact car joint venture with China Guizhou Aviation and China Guizhou Joint Automotive Industrial.
- State Economic and Foreign Trade Commission issues notice ordering regulation of chaotic liquor production and new bid to clamp down on smuggling.
- Competition in mobile phone market heats up in Beijing as Unicom and Beijing Wireless Communication Bureau cut prices.

- Communist Party newspaper gives front-page coverage to Politburo standing committee member Hu Jintao in making call for stepped up efforts in education. Hu made the remarks at a meeting with students and teachers for International Children's Day.
